page.title: 15Local History in W.Bassett
page.content: { Milo Crispin }owned most of the land in Wootton Bassett and was mentioned in the original Domesday Book.It was ploughland,pasture and woodland.It was worth Â£9. The{Bassett Family }built a Manor House called Vastern.One of the family shared in the signing of Magna Carta and another Bassett founded a Priory in Wood Street.One of the oldest houses in our town is built on the site of the Old Priory.It is called Priory Cottage. The{Town Hall}is different from others because it stands on 15 pillars.It has been there from 1690 and its stocks were used to punish disorderly people. The town has grown a lot in the{last {10 years }because it is near the M4 Motorway and RAF Lyneham.Now it has no Member of Parliament of its own.
